SourceText: Let‚Äôs check in on another family to see how the mother praises her son, {F3_SON_4}, during one-on-one time.

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYou found a striped sock and one with dots. Let‚Äôs find the socks that match those two.‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: "Ufumene ikawusi enemigca enye inamachokoza. Masifumane iikawusi ezihambelana nezo zimbini."

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúAnother sock! This one is white. It isn‚Äôt easy finding a matching pair. It can be frustrating.‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**. "Enye ikawusi! Le imhlophe. Akukho lula ukufumana iperi ehambelanayo. Kunoku dika."

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYou are being very patient and looking very hard, {F3_SON_4}. Well done for trying.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYou found two socks with the same pattern! Well done for looking, {F3_SON_4}!‚Äù

SourceText: üíö That's OK! Sometimes, things take time. You can review this lesson in the Main Menu at any time. At the end of the day, think of all of the positive things that happened - this makes it easier to point them out. ‚òÄÔ∏è With time, it will become easier for you to praise your child.

Ekupheleni kosuku, cinga ngazo zonke izinto ezintle ezenzekileyo - oku kwenza kube lula ukuzikhomba. Ngokuhamba kwexesha, kuya kubalula kuwe ukuncoma umntwana wakho.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWell done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}! Now let‚Äôs brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYou did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend together. What would you like to do?‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: "Wenze kakuhle ngokulungiselela ukuya ebhedini! Ngoku, sinemizuzu emi- 5 yexesha sisodwa. Yintoni ongathanda siyenze?"

text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: "Yay! Ungandifundela ibali lam endilithandayo?"

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚Äú ‚ÄúThe end‚Ä¶.‚Äù Such a lovely story! Goodnight, my baby girl. I love you very much.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: "Isiphelo....." Ibali elimnandi kangaka! Busuku benzolo, sana lwam eliyintombi. Ndiyakuthanda kakhulu."

SourceText: üí° Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions that each send us a very specific message:
text: üí°Funda malunga neemvakalelo ezahlukeneyo. Kukho iimvakalelo ezi-6 ezisisekelo nganye ithumela umyalezo ocacicleyo:

SourceText: üòÉHappy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.
text: üòÉUkonwaba: Qhubeka usenza izinto ezikwenza uzive wonwabile.

SourceText: üòîSad: Something important in your life needs attention.
text: üòîUkukhathazeka: Into ebalulekileyo ebomini bakho edinga ingqwalasela.

SourceText: üî¥Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.
text: üî¥Umsindo: Zimele ngokunokwakho kwaye umisele imida.

SourceText: üò£Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.
text: üò£Ukucaphuka: Yima kude kwinto ongayithandiyo.

SourceText: üëÄSurprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.
text: üëÄMangalisekile: Yeka kwaye nika ingqwalasela okomzuzwana.

SourceText: üö©Afraid: Run away from danger.
text: üö©Ukoyika: Balekela kude kwingozi.

SourceText: üé® As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.

SourceText: This lesson is about how we can stay calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our children. üíö
text: Esi isifundo simalunga nokuba singazigcina njani sizolile kunye nokulawula imisindo yethu xana sijongene nemizuzu yonxinzelelo kunye nabantwana bethu. üíö

SourceText: As you began noticing feelings, you may have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness.
text: Njengokuba uqalisa ukuqaphela iimvakakelelo, ungabe sewuqalile ukuqaphela iimvakalelo zomsindo okanye ezokhathazeka.

SourceText: üå∑ We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: üå∑ Siyabathanda abantwana bethu, kodwa uxinzelelo lokunakekela kunye nakwezinye iziganeko singasenza sizive sinomsindo. Lento yinto eqhelekileyo ebomini!

SourceText: üí° It is important for us to try to stay calm in order to help manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: üí° Kubalulekile kuthi ukuba sihlale sizibambile kwaye silawula imisindo ukwenzela singalimazi abanye.

SourceText: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so they stop misbehaving.
text: Xana ndinomsindo emntwaneni wam ofikisayo, Ndiyabonisa ukuba ndinomsindo ukwenzela bayeke ukuziphatha kakubi.

SourceText: üíõ It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your anger before doing anything.
text: üíõKunganzima xana umntwana wakho ofikisayo eziphatha kakubi, kodwa kufuneka uzame ukulawula uxinzelelo kwaye sibambe umsindo wethu phambi kokwenza nantoni.

SourceText: üå± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
text: üå±Ukuphefumla kambalwa kunganceda. Ukubanomsindo kungenza utsho okanye wenze izinto ozakuthi uzisole.

SourceText: Let‚Äôs see how {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_13} spend one-on-one time together:
text: Masibone ukuba u{F1_FATHER} kunye no{F1_DAUGHTER_13} bachitha njani ixesha bebobabini:

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, how was your day?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: "{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, belunjani usuku lwakho?"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúMy day was good, {F1_FATHER}. I just came from school.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: "Usuku lwam belulungile, {F1_FATHER}. ndisandokubuya esikolweni."

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spare before I have to drive to work again. What would you like to do together?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**:"Ndinemizuzu emi- 5 yexesha lethu sobabini endinalo phambi kokuba ndiqhube ndiye emsebenzini kwakhona. Yintoni obungathanda siyenze kunye?"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI was about to do my Science homework. The topic for the homework is to make something out of recycled materials. Could you please help me with it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**:"Bendizakwenza umsebenzi we Nzululwazi. Isihloko salomsebenzi wasekhaya kukwenza into yoku risayikilisha imathiriyeli. Ungakwazi ukunceda ngayo?"

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI would be happy to!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: "Ndingathanda ukwenza!"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI thought of building a recycled house using old bottles, boxes, and other recycled materials. Look! I picked these up on my way home. They were thrown away by the side of the road and outside the spaza shops.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: "Bendicinga ngokwakha indlu yerisayikila ndisebenzise iibhotile ezindala, ibhokisi, kunye nenye imathiriyeli. Jonga! Ndichole ezizinto endleleni ebuyela ekhaya. Bezilahlwe ecaleni kwendlela nangaphandle kwasevenkileni."

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWhat a good idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Sounds like you‚Äôve thought about this a lot and want to put a lot of effort into your homework. How do you want me to help you?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**:"Ngumbono olungileyo lowo, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Kuvakala ingathi ucingisisile malunga nalento kakhulu kwaye ufuna ukufaka umzamo omkhulu  kulomsebenzi wasekhaya. Ufuna ndincede phi mna ukunceda wena?"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúCould you help me clean these bottles? They will be the pillars of the house. I will make the boxes into the walls and roof of the house. Later, I thought we could paint the boxes and bottles so they look beautiful.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**. "Ungakwazi ukundinceda ndicoce ezibhotile? Zizakuba ziintsika zalendlu. Ndizozenza iibhokisi zibe ziindonga kunye nophahla lwendlu. Kamva, bendicinga singakwazi ukupeyinta iibhokisi kunye neebhotile ukuze zibukeke kakuhle."

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI may have some leftover paint outside the house. I can take a look later.‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: " Ndinganayo enye ipeyinti eshekele umphandle wendlu. Ndingajonga kamva."

SourceText: (Later in the day)
text: (Kamva ngala suku)

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWow, it looks different now! It does not look like you used rubbish at all anymore. You also painted the walls and the roof beautifully! I think your teacher will be proud of you when she sees your homework!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**."Wowu, ikhangeleka yohlukile ngoku! Ayibukeki ngathi usebenzise izinto esezisetyenzisiwe konke konke kwakhona. Uye wapeyinta nodonga kunye nophahla kakuhle! Ndicinga utitshala wakho uzozingca ngawe xana ebona umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya!"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúThank you for your help, {F1_FATHER}. You know, there were a lot of fun things that happened in school today.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: "Enkosi ngoncedo lwakho, {F1_FATHER}. Uyayazi, bekukho izinto ezininzi esikolweni ebezisonwabisa ezenzekileyo namhlanje."

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúGo ahead, tell me!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**. "Qhubeka, xelela mna!"

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_16} are spending one-on-one time by taking a walk together. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} looks very upset.
text: U{F1_FATHER} kunye no{F1_DAUGHTER_16} bachitha ixesha bebobabini ngokuhamba kunye. U{F1_DAUGHTER_16} ubonakala ekhathazeke kakhulu.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, I noticed you have less energy today and you look sad. Do you want to talk about it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: "{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, ndiqaphele ukuba unamandla amancinci namhlanje kwaye ukhangeleka lusizi. Uyafuna ukuthetha ngayo?"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúOh, {F1_FATHER}. I studied so hard for my maths test and failed. I feel so sad and frustrated.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: "Oh, {F1_FATHER}. Ndifunde nzima kuvavanyo lwam lwematematika ndaza ndatshona. Ndiziva ndilusizi kwaye ndikhathazekile."

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúThat is frustrating, my girl. I know how hard you studied. Maybe we can come up with a new plan to help you with maths. Should we ask your teacher for extra help? Would you like me to talk to her or do you want to do it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: "Iyacaphukisa lonto ke, ntombam. Ndiyayazi indlela ofunde ngayo. Mhlawumbi singaza nesicwangciso esitsha sokukunceda kwimathematika. Ingaba kufuneka sicele uncedo olongezelelweyo kutitshala wakho? Ngaba ungathanda ukuba ndithethe naye okanye ufuna ukuyenza ngokwakho?"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúThank you, {F1_FATHER}. I can do it! I think that might be a good idea.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: "Enkosi, {F1_FATHER}. Ndingakwazi ukuyenza! Ndicinga ukuba ingangumbono omhle lowo."

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúYou know, maths may be difficult for you, but I am so proud of you for studying so hard, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Other people might give up, but you keep trying. That will help you so much in life!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: "Uyayazi, imathematika inokuba nzima kuwe, kodwa ndiyazingca ngawe ngokufunda nzima, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Abanye abantu bangancama, kodwa wena uqhubeke uzama. Oko kuya kukunceda kakhulu ebomini!"

SourceText: ‚≠ê Do some active exercise to shake out anger, give each other some space, or take some deep breaths to calm down. These are some ways to deal with your emotions.

SourceText: This lesson is about how we can keep calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our teens. üíö
text: Esi isifundo asimalunga nokuba uzigcina njani uzolile kunye nokulawula imisindo yethu xana umelana nemizuzu yonxinzelelo kunye nabantwana bethu abafikisayo. üíö

SourceText: üå∑ We love our teens, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: üå∑ Siyabathanda abantwana bethu, kodwa uxinzelelo lokunakekela kunye nakwezinye iziganeko zingasenza sizive sinomsindo. Lento yinto eqhelekileyo ebomini!

SourceText: üí° It is important for us to stay in control and manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: üí° Kubalulekile kuthi ukuba sihlale sizibambile kwaye silawula imisindo ukwenzela singalimazi abanye.

SourceText: True or False: When I am angry at my teen, I should show that I am angry so that they stop misbehaving.
text: Yinyani okanye ayonyani: Xana ndinomsindo emntwaneni wam ofikisayo, Ndiyabonisa ukuba ndinomsindo ukwenzela bayeke ukuziphatha kakubi.

SourceText: üíõ It can be very difficult when your teen is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything.
text: üíõKunganzima xana umntwana wakho ofikisayo eziphatha kakubi, kodwa kufuneka uzame ukulawula uxinzelelo kwaye sibambe umsindo wethu phambi kokwenza nantoni.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} is about to spend one-on-one time with {F2_SON_15} but finds the living room in a mess. She notices that this makes her feel angry.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} imalunga nokuchitha ixesha kunye no{F2_SON_15} ninodwa kodwa ukufumana igumbi lokuhlala limdaka. Uqaphele ukuba imenza azive enomsindo.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI‚Äôm feeling really angry. I am tired and my body feels tense. I just want to shout at {F2_SON_15}‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (ecinga): "Ndiziva ndinomsindo ngenene. Ndidiniwe kwaye umzimba wam uziva ubambekile. Ndifuna ukukhwaza u{F2_SON_15}‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI will Take a Pause and put on my favourite song.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**(ecinga):"Ndizakuthi nqumama kwaye ndivule umculo wam endiwuthandayo."

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI am feeling a little better. I can think more clearly about what to do to support my teen.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**(ecinga):"Ndiziva ndingcono kancinci. Ndiyakwazi ukucinga ngokucacileyo malunga ndingenza ntoni ukuxhasa umntwana wam."

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚Äú{F2_SON_15}, well done for doing your homework. You might  feel tired now. Let's take a 5-minute break, and after that, we can quickly pick up the mess together.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**:  ‚Äú{F2_SON_15}, wenze kakuhle ukwenza umsebenzi wakho wesikolo. Inokuba uziva udiniwe. Makhe sithathe imizuzu emi- 5 yokuphumla, emva koko, singake sichola-chole izinto kunye."

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúThank you for doing your part to keep the house clean, {F2_SON_15}! I‚Äôm so proud of you for helping. Oh! It is our one-on-one time. What would you like to do?‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: "Enkosi ngokwenza eyakho ingxenye ukugcina indlu icocekile, {F2_SON_15}! Ndiyazingca ngawe ngokuncedisa. Oh! lixesha lethu sisodwa. Ungathanda senze ntoni?"

SourceText: ‚≠ê Before you focus on supporting others, it‚Äôs important to take care of yourself.
text: ‚≠ê Ngaphambi kokuba ugxile ekuxhaseni abanye, kubalulekile ukuba uzikhathalele.

SourceText: üò£ Feeling stressed as your children grow up is normal. As your relationship with them changes, it‚Äôs important to handle this shift well, and that starts with self-care.
text: üò£ Ukuziva unoxinzelelo njengoko abantwana bakho bekhula kuqhelekile. Njengoko nobudlelwane bakho nabo butshintsha, kubalulekile ukuphatha olutshintsho kakuhle, kwaye oko kuqala ngokuzikhathalela.

SourceText: üå± Self-care means doing things for yourself to reduce stress and make you feel better.
text: üå± Ukuzikhathalela kuthetha ukuzenzela izinto ngokwakho ukunciphisa uxinzelelo kwaye kukwenza uzive ungcono.

SourceText: ‚è∞ Let‚Äôs learn a simple way to handle everyday stress: Taking a pause.
text: ‚è∞ Masifunde indlela elula yokumelana noxinzelelo lwamihla yonke: Ukuthatha ikhefu.

SourceText: ‚ôª We will use this skill frequently in future lessons, so it is important to learn it today!
text: ‚ôª Sizakusebenzisa esisakhono rhoqo kwizifundo ezizayo, ke kubalulekile ukusifunda namhlanje!

SourceText: Taking a pause will help you manage stress and be more able to take care of others and yourself.üå±
text: Ukunqumama kuya kukunceda ulawule uxinzelelo kwaye ukwazi ngakumbi ukukhathalela abanye kunye nawe. üå±

SourceText: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èPress Play to practise taking a pause together.
text: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Cofa Dlala ukuzama ukunqumama kunye...

SourceText: Try taking a pause whenever you feel angry, overwhelmed, stressed or worried. ‚è∞
text: Zama ukuthetha nangeliphina ixesha uziva unomsindo, udiniwe, unoxinzelelo okanye ukhathazekile.‚è∞

SourceText: Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also take a pause with your child or teen.
text: Nokuba kukuphefumla kambalwa okanye nokunxulumana kunye nomhlaba ngaphantsi kungenza umehluko. Ungathi nqumama kunye nomntwana wakho okanye ofikisayo.

SourceText: Try taking a pause on a daily basis, even if you are feeling calm. Doing this regularly will help your brain take a pause, even in challenging situations.
text: Zama ukuthi nqumama ngemihla ngemihla, nokuba uziva uzolile. Ukwenza lento rhoqo kunganceda ingqondo yakho ithi nqumama, nakwizimo ezingumceli-mngeni.

SourceText: Well done! üéâ You have learnt the importance of caring for yourself and how to take a pause. ‚ú®
text: Wenza kakuhle üéâ Ufundile ukubaluleka kokuzikhathalela wena nokuba uthi nqumama njani. ‚ú®

SourceText: 1Ô∏è‚É£ **SIT DOWN**
text: 1Ô∏è‚É£ **HLALA PHANTSI**

SourceText: ‚è∏  Find a place where you can sit comfortably.
text: ‚è∏ Fumana indawo onokuhlala kuyo ngokukhululekileyo.

SourceText: ‚≠ê You can close your eyes if you want.
text: ‚≠ê Ungavala amehlo akho ukuba uyafuna.

text: 2Ô∏è‚É£ **MAMELA**

SourceText: üå± Take a deep breath.
text: üå± Thatha umphefumlo onzulu.

SourceText: üëÇ Feel the air moving in and out of your body.
text: üëÇ Yiva umoya ungena kwaye uphuma emzimbeni wakho.

SourceText: üîÑ Repeat this 5 times.
text: üîÑ Phinda oku ka-5.

SourceText: 3Ô∏è‚É£ **NOTICE**
text: 3Ô∏è‚É£ **QAPHELA**

SourceText: ‚ú® Notice how your body feels while you breathe.
text: ‚ú® Qaphela indlela umzimba wakho oziva ngayo ngelixa uphefumla.

SourceText: üîµ Notice where you feel tension in your body and try to let it go.
text: üîµ Qaphela apho uva uxinzelelo emzimbeni wakho kwaye uzame ukuwuyeka.

SourceText: 4Ô∏è‚É£ **OPEN YOUR EYES**
text: 4Ô∏è‚É£ **VULA AMEHLO AKHO**

text: üîë Qaphela ukuba ingaba uziva ngokwahlukileyo kunokuqala kwakho lo msebenzi.

SourceText: ‚ú®Think of a time each day that you could spare 5 minutes. You can even make household chores into a game to do together.

SourceText: You can also express enthusiasm by clapping, smiling, or giving them a thumbs-up.
text: Ungabonisa umdla ngoku qhwaba, ukuncuma, okanye ngokunyusa oobhotsi phezulu.

SourceText: ‚öΩ Competitive games can be hard for teens (and adults!) if they don‚Äôt like losing.
text: ‚öΩImidlalo yokhuphiswano inganzima kumntwana wakho ofikisayo (nabantu abadala!) ukuba abafuni ukohluleka.

SourceText: üèÜ When they have calmed down, talk with your teen about what winning well and losing well might look like.
text: üèÜXana besele bezolile, thetha nomntwana wakho ofikisayo malunga nokuba kunjani ukuphumelela kakuhle kunye nokohluleka kakuhle kungakhangeleka njani.

SourceText: üìù Suggest other activities that you can do to work together instead of against each other.
text: üìùCebisa eminye imidlalo eningayenza ukunzela nisebenze nobabini endaweni yokuchasana.

SourceText: üî¥ It can be difficult to spend one-on-one time with each of your teens when you have more than one.
text: üî¥ Kunokuba nzima ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana ngamnye wakho ofikisayo xa unabaninzi.

SourceText: üå± If possible, you can ask an adult or older sibling to look after the other teens while you spend one-on-one time with one teen.
text: üå± Ukuba kuyenzeka, unokucela umntu omdala okanye umntakokwenu ukuba ajonge abanye abantwana bakho abafikisayo ngelixa uchitha ixesha ninodwa kunye nomntwana wakho ofikisayo omnye.

SourceText: ‚è∞ Think of when it would be easier to spend one-on-one time with each of your teens. Perhaps later in the evening with your teen, after the others have gone to sleep.
text: ‚è∞ Cinga ngexesha ekuya kuba lula ngalo ukuchitha ixesha nomntwana ninodwa ngamnye ofikisayo. Mhlawumbi kamva ngokuhlwa nomntwana wakho ofikisayo, emva kokuba abanye beye kulala.

SourceText: üíõ You can also spend one-on-one time with all of your teens at once! If you do, make sure all are able to participate in one-on-one time.
text: üíõ Unokuphinda uchithe ixesha ninodwa kunye nabo bonke abantwana bakho abafikisayo ngaxeshanye! Ukuba wenza njalo, qiniseka ukuba bonke bayakwazi ukuthatha inxaxheba ngexesha elinye.

text: Kunokuba nzima ukufumana ixesha phakathi kosuku lwakho, ngumsebenzi, imisebenzi yasekhaya kunye nayo yonke enye into.

SourceText: Use the time that you and your children are already sharing, like eating a meal or saying goodnight before bed.
text: Sebenzisa ixesha apho wena nomntwana wakho benisele nisabelana ngalo, njengo kutya ukutya okanye nivalelisana phambi kokuya kulala.

SourceText: üòî It can hurt when your child does not want to spend one-on-one time with you.
text: üòî Kunokuba buhlungu xa umntwana wakho engafuni ukuchitha ixesha kunye nawe.

SourceText: üíô Try again so that your child can see that you care and want to spend this time with them.
text: üíô Zama kwakhona ukuze umntwana wakho abone ukuba umkhathalele kwaye ufuna ukuchitha eli xesha kunye naye.

SourceText: üì∫Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a phone or tablet.
text: üì∫Abantwana bahlala befuna ukuchitha ixesha bebukele umabonakude okanye bedlala ngefowuni okanye ithebhulethi.

SourceText: üíö Caring about their interests is a great start!
text: üíö Ukukhathala malunga nezinto abanomdla kuzo sisiqalo esihle!

SourceText: üå∑ Once you begin spending time together you can suggest another activity.
text: üå∑Ukuba nikhe naqala nje ukuchitha ixesha kunye ningacebisa omnye umsebenzi.

SourceText: ‚òÄÔ∏è If your child wants to do things that are too difficult for you to do, you could watch them.
text: ‚òÄÔ∏è Ukuba umntwana wakho ufuna ukwenza izinto ekunzima kakhulu ukuba uzenze, unokumbukela.

SourceText: üèÅ You could describe what they are doing like a sports commentator.
text: üèÅ Ungayichaza into abayenzayo njengomsasazi wezemidlalo.

SourceText: ‚öΩ Competitive games can be hard for your child (and adults!) if they don‚Äôt like losing.
text: ‚öΩ Imidlalo yokhuphiswano inokuba nzima kumntwana wakho (kunye nabantu abadala!) ukuba abakuthandi ukulahlekelwa.

SourceText: üèÜ When they have calmed down, talk with your child about what winning well and losing well might look like.
text: üèÜ Xa bezolile, thetha nomntwana wakho malunga nokuba ukuphumelela kakuhle kunye nokulahlekelwa kakuhle kunokubonakala njani.

SourceText: üî¥ It can be difficult to spend one-on-one time with each of your children when you have more than one.
text: üî¥Kunokuba nzima ukuchitha ixesha lomntu nomntu ngamnye kubantwana bakho xa unabaninzi.

SourceText: üå± If possible, you can ask an adult or older brother or sister to look after your other children while you spend one-on-one time with your child.
text: üå± Ukuba kuyenzeka, unokucela umntu omdala okanye umntakwenu okanye udadewenu ukuba ajonge abanye abantwana bakho ngelixa uchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho.

SourceText: ‚è∞ Think of when it would be easier to spend one-on-one time with each of your children.
text: ‚è∞ Cinga ngexesha ekuya kuba lula ngalo ukuchitha ixesha kunye nomntwana wakho ngamnye.

SourceText: üíõ You can also spend one-on-one time with all of your children at once! If you do, make sure all are able to participate in one-on-one time.
text: üíõ Unokuphinda uchithe ixesha elinye kunye nabo bonke abantwana bakho ngaxeshanye! Ukuba wenza njalo, qiniseka ukuba bonke bayakwazi ukuthatha inxaxheba ngexesha elinye.

SourceText: Type {PLAY} for a fun activity suggestion for a group of children. üí°
text: Chwetheza {PLAY} iingcebiso zemidlalo eyonwabisayo zeqela labantwana.üí°

SourceText: üíõ We are sorry to hear that you have been finding it hard to spend one-on-one time with your child.
text: üíõ Siyaxolisa ukuva ukuba ubufumana kunzima ukuchitha ixesha nomntwana wakho.
